contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "someone had written on both its front and its back" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it had been written on both its front and back

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "There will no longer be anyone to worship at your altars and your enemy will destroy your pillars" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then your altars will become desolate and your pillars will be destroyed

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Enemy armies will lay waste your cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: cities will be laid waste

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. See how you translated "pillars" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:04|6:4]]. AT: "they will cut down your pillars" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: your pillars will be cut down

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "when I scatter you in different countries" or "when I force you to live in other countries" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when you are scattered throughout the countries

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "God will not strengthen anyone who continues to sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: no man living in his sin will be strengthened

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "they will not be able to satisfy their hunger" or "they will still be hungry even after they eat all they have" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: their hunger will not be satisfied

contextId.information: The word "Whirling" means "Spinning." Here it is the name of the wheels. This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone called the wheels, 'Whirling'" or "the name of the wheels was Whirling" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the wheels were called, "Whirling."

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh has given this land to us as our possession" or "This land has become our possession" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This land was given to us as our possession

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "where I scattered you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: where you were scattered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "just as Yahweh commanded me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: just as I was commanded

contextId.information: The word "fullness" refers to everything in the land. The word "despoiled" means that people will empty the land of everything in it. This can be stated in active form. AT: "others will empty the land of everything in it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the land will be despoiled of its fullness

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will fulfill every vision" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: every vision will be fulfilled

contextId.information: This probably refers to an official record of the citizens of Israel. This can be stated in active form. AT: "nor will anyone enroll their names in the record of the house of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: or enrolled in the record of the house of Israel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they would only rescue their own lives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: only their own lives would be rescued

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they would only rescue their own lives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: only their own lives would be rescued

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If a person throws it into a fire as fuel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If it is thrown into a fire as fuel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "your parents threw you out into the open field" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you were thrown out into the open field

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will humiliate you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be humiliated

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will restore your sister Sodom and her daughters to their former condition" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: your sister Sodom and her daughters will be restored to their former condition

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will restore you and your daughters to your former condition" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you and your daughters will be restored to your former condition

contextId.information: Here the word "mouth" represents the person who speaks. This can be stated in active form. AT: "You did not even mention your sister Sodom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Sodom your sister was not even mentioned by your mouth

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The first eagle had planted the vine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It had been planted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he has not taken what someone has stolen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he has not taken what was stolen

contextId.information: The idiom "call to mind" means to remember. This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will not remember all the righteousness that he had done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: All the righteousness that he had done will not be called to mind

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh uprooted the vine in fury and threw it down" or "people uprooted the vine in fury and threw it down" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the vine was uprooted in fury and thrown down

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will not allow you to inquire of me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I will not be inquired of by you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:20:08|20:9]]. AT: "so that the people would not profane it in the eyes of the nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so it would not be profaned in the eyes of the nations

contextId.information: The name "Bamah" means "high place," a place for worshiping idols. This can be stated in active form. AT: "People have called that place Bamah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the name is called Bamah

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The fiery flame will not go out" or "No one will be able to quench the fiery flame" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The fiery flame will not be quenched

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. The "enemy's hand" represents the enemy's control. AT: "your enemy will capture you and take you into captivity" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: you will be captured by your enemy's hand

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "No one will remember you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: You will not be remembered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and profane me among themselves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that I am profaned in their midst

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Men squeezed their breasts." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Their breasts were squeezed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. The word "Sabeans" refers to people from Sheba. AT: "Sabeans had come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: Sabeans were brought

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for the company to terrorize and plunder them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be terrorized and plundered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "burn the bones" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: let the bones be charred

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to melt the uncleanness within it and to consume its corrosion" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so its uncleanness within it will be melted, its corrosion consumed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "against my sanctuary when the enemy army profaned it"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: over my sanctuary when it was profaned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "No one will hear the sound of your harps anymore." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The sound of your harps will be heard no more

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will make you a place where nets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will become a place where nets

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The ships of Tarshish carried your merchandise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The ships of Tarshish were the transporters of your merchandise

contextId.information: This can be expressed in active form. AT: "When people brought your merchandise ashore" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When your merchandise went ashore

contextId.information: This can be expressed in active form. AT: "when the seas, the deep waters, shattered you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when you were shattered by the seas, by deep waters

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I prepared them on the day that I created you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It was on the day you were created that they were prepared

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I destroy all of the allies of Egypt" or "when armies destroy all of those who help Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all of her helpers are destroyed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. And the abstract noun "death" can be stated "die." AT: "For I made it so that they all will die and go deep under the ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: All of them have been assigned to death, to the earth below

contextId.information: This can be put into active form. AT: "When I make the land of Egypt a place where no one is living" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When I make the land of Egypt an abandoned place

contextId.information: This can be put into active form. AT: "whom enemies killed with swords" or "who died in battle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: who were killed by the sword

contextId.information: "Broken" here represents "destroyed." This can be put in active form. AT: "I will destroy you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: you ... will be broken

contextId.information: This can be put in active form. AT: "Others will lay him in the midst of the uncircumcised" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he will be laid down in the midst of the uncircumcised

contextId.information: The phrase "the city" refers to "Jerusalem." This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Babylonians have destroyed Jerusalem"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The city has been captured

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh has given us the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The land has been given to us

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one will lived in the mountains of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the mountains of Israel will be deserted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that someone plays very well on a stringed instrument" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that is well played on a stringed instrument

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Then they scattered because they did not have shepherd" or "they scattered because you did not do what the shepherd should do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then they were scattered without a shepherd

contextId.information: Here "swords" represents enemies who fought them in battle. This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:31:17|31:17]]. AT: "those whom enemies have killed with swords" or "those who have died in battle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: those killed by the sword

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. It may be an exaggeration for emphasis. AT: "People will not live in your cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: Your cities will not be inhabited

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "my people, Israel, will plow your ground and sow it with seed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be plowed and sown with seed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) AT: "that enemies had torn down" or 2) AT: "that people could not get into." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that were torn down

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Yahweh had commanded me to speak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as I was commanded

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Yahweh had commanded me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as I was commanded

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will call you to come for war" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: You will be called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will bring the Israelites out" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the land's people will be brought out

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will make mountains fall down" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]]
contextId.quote: The mountains will be thrown down

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the Babylonians captured the city of Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the city was captured

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they killed the burnt offering" or "they killed the animals that they would burn as an offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the burnt offering was slaughtered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they would put the flesh of the offerings on the tables" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the flesh of the offerings would be put on the tables

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "no one will open it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will not be opened

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "that they need to do in it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that is done in it

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "You will use these contributions for." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be used for

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Levites will open the gate facing east for him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the gate facing east will be opened for him
